comment: Smart Data models Vessel schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.MarineTransport/master/Vessel/schema.json
description: The data model is intended to provide information about vessels. It allows to represent the properties of each vessel: static and dynamic information

contents.name: airDraught
contents.comment: Air Draught (distance from the top of a vessel''s highest point to its waterline)

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: beam
contents.comment: Beam of Vessel

contents.name: buildingAt
contents.comment: Date and time of building of the vessel represented by an ISO 8601 UTC format

contents.name: callSign
contents.comment: Maritime call signs are call signs assigned as unique identifiers to vessels

contents.name: courseOverGround
contents.comment: Course Over Ground (COG)

contents.name: createdAt
contents.comment: Date and time of creation of the entity represented by an ISO 8601 UTC format

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: deadweightTonnage
contents.comment: Deadweight Tonnage (DWT)

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: destinationPort
contents.comment: Destination Port (Geographic coding scheme UN/LOCODE (United Nations Code for Trade and Transport Locations). https://unece.org/trade/publications/recommendation-ndeg16-united-nations-code-trade-and-transport-locations)

contents.name: draught
contents.comment: Draught (vertical distance between the waterline and the bottom of the hull (keel))

contents.name: estimatedTimeOfArrival
contents.comment: Estimated time of arrival, as it was originally planned and entered by the shipper, represented by an ISO 8601 UTC format

contents.name: financialOwner
contents.comment: Financial Owner

contents.name: flagCode
contents.comment: International Flag Code (ISO 3166-1 alfa-2)

contents.name: grossTonnage
contents.comment: Gross Tonnage (GT)

contents.name: heading
contents.comment: Heading of the Vessel (HDG)

contents.name: imo
contents.comment: International Maritime Organization Number (a global forever UID)

contents.name: length
contents.comment: Length of Vessel

contents.name: manager
contents.comment: Manager Vessel

contents.name: maximumDraught
contents.comment: Maximum Draught

contents.name: mmsi
contents.comment: Marine Mobile Service Identity Number (a temporarily assigned UID, issued by that object's current flag state)

contents.name: modifiedAt
contents.comment: Date and time of last modification of the entity represented by an ISO 8601 UTC format

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item

contents.name: navigationStatus
contents.comment: Enum: '0=Under way using engine,1=At anchor,2=Not under command,3=Restricted manoeuverability,4=Constrained by her draught,5=Moored,6=Aground,7=Engaged in Fishing,8=Under way sailing,9=Reserved for future amendment of Navigational Status for HSC,10=Reserved for future amendment of Navigational Status for WIG,11=Reserved for future use,12=Reserved for future use,13=Reserved for future use,14=AIS-SART is active,15=Not defined (default)'. Navigation Status. AIVDM/AIVDO data format

contents.name: observedAt
contents.comment: Date and time of this observation represented by an ISO 8601 UTC format

contents.name: ownerVessel
contents.comment: Owner Vessel

contents.name: photo
contents.comment: Vessel Photo URL

contents.name: positionAccuracy
contents.comment: global navigation satellite system (GNSS) receiver or of other electronic position fixing device; default),1=High (< 10 m; differential mode of e.g. DGNSS receiver)'. Code for the accuracy of the vessel position flag

contents.name: previousPort
contents.comment: Previous Port (Geographic coding scheme UN/LOCODE (United Nations Code for Trade and Transport Locations). https://unece.org/trade/publications/recommendation-ndeg16-united-nations-code-trade-and-transport-locations)

contents.name: rateOfTurn
contents.comment: Rate of Turn (ROT)

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: specialManeuverIndicator
contents.comment: Enum: '0=Not available (default),1=Not engaged in special maneuver,2=Engaged in special maneuver'. Code for the special maneuver flag

contents.name: speedOverGround
contents.comment: Speed Over Ground (SOG)

contents.name: technicalManager
contents.comment: Technical Manager

contents.name: toBow
contents.comment: Dimension to Bow

contents.name: toPort
contents.comment: Dimension to Port

contents.name: toStardboard
contents.comment: Dimension to Starboard

contents.name: toStern
contents.comment: Dimension to Stern

contents.name: vesselSubType
contents.comment: Enum: '0=Not available (default),1-19=Reserved for future use,20=Wing in ground (WIG), all ships of this type,21=Wing in ground (WIG), Hazardous category A,22=Wing in ground (WIG), Hazardous category B,23=Wing in ground (WIG), Hazardous category C,24=Wing in ground (WIG), Hazardous category D,25-29=Wing in ground (WIG), Reserved for future use,30=Fishing,31=Towing,32=Towing: length exceeds 200m or breadth exceeds 25m,33=Dredging or underwater ops,34=Diving ops,35=Military ops,36=Sailing,37=Pleasure Craft,38

contents.name: vesselType
contents.comment: Enum: '1=Reserved,2=Wing In Ground,3=Special Category,4=High-Speed Craft,5=Special Category,6=Passenger,7=Cargo,8=Tanker,9=Other'. Code for vessel type

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
